definition: to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter

sentences.english: Double-entry-accounting: A system of recording every business transaction with equal dollar amounts of both debit and credit entries.
sentences.chinese: 在借方和贷方用相等的金额记录经济事项的记账系统。

sentences.english: The banks’ troubled debtors are also different.
sentences.chinese: 拖欠银行债务的借方也不同。

sentences.english: The bank debited ￡10 from Mr Smith's account.
sentences.chinese: 银行把一笔十镑的帐记入史密斯先生借方栏。

sentences.english: The store debited the purchase to her account.
sentences.chinese: 商店把购货金额记入她的账户的借方。

sentences.english: The account of withdrawals has debit balances.
If a lender agrees to a redaction reduction, the government will would partly match their the amount.
sentences.chinese: 如果出借方同意减少，政府可补足部分款项。

sentences.english: It would see lenders write down the mortgage amount in exchange for a government guarantee.
sentences.chinese: 此举会导致出借方提供抵押贷款额以换取政府保障。

sentences.english: Equality of totals in the debit and credit sides of an account.
sentences.chinese: 对借方余额和贷方余额是否相等的验证就叫做试算表。

sentences.english: Comparing debit and credit balances for equality.
sentences.chinese: 比较借方和贷方余额是否相同。

sentences.english: Of course, that means 98% of homes are not being reclaimed by lenders.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这也意味着98%的房屋并没有被出借方没收。

sentences.english: Fortunately, this is a borrower's market.
sentences.chinese: 所幸的是，现在是借方的市场。

sentences.english: Our debit note no. 40 is still unsettled. please send remittance to cover it.
sentences.chinese: 我方第40号借方通知仍未得到偿付，请汇款来结帐。

sentences.english: The store debited the purchase to/against her account.
sentences.chinese: 商店把购货金额记入她账户的借方。

sentences.english: In a compound entry, all the credits are listed under the debits.
sentences.chinese: 在复合分录中，所有贷方应列在借方之下。

sentences.english: The store debited his account for the purchase.
sentences.chinese: 商店将这笔购货金额记入他的账户的借方。

sentences.english: However, the main effect is to take risk off the table for lenders.
sentences.chinese: 然而，产生的主要的结果却是让出借方可以免除风险。

definition: (of a sum of money etc) receivable
an allowance/to allow for (a drop in value) (accountancy)
